name: 20 Ounce
short_description: This heirloom variety is famous not only for its size, but excellent cooking qualities as well.
full_description: This heirloom variety is famous not only for its size, but excellent cooking qualities as well.
profile: Pale yellow fleshFirm, tender, juicy and tart
best_uses: Excellent for cookingBest for pies, apple sauce and baking
special_hint: It’s Grandma’s favorite apple for pies.

name: Acey Mac
short_description: Sweet, tart and juicy.
full_description: Sweet, tart and juicy.
profile: SweetTartJuicy
best_uses: Excellent for fresh eatingGood for sauces
special_hint: Tender flesh cooks quickly, so add a thickener if making a pie.

name: Autumn Crisp
short_description: Cross between a Golden Delicious and a Monroe apple. Extra crisp and juicy. Excellent for apple slice snacks.
full_description: Cross between a Golden Delicious and a Monroe apple. Extra crisp and juicy. Excellent for apple slice snacks.

name: Braeburn
short_description: Sweet, tangy and juicy.
full_description: Sweet, tangy and juicy.
profile: Sweet and tangy flavorAromatic and juicySuper crisp texture with yellow flesh
best_uses: Excellent for snacking and cookingGood for sauces and salads
special_hint: This ultra-crisp apple will appeal to teens, a great way to encourage healthy snacking.

name: Cameo
short_description: A bright, red-striped apple with a creamy orange color; firm and crisp. It has a thin skin with a sweet/tart flavor, and makes a great fresh eating apple. You may even notice a hint of pear.
full_description: A bright, red-striped apple with a creamy orange color; firm and crisp. It has a thin skin with a sweet/tart flavor, and makes a great fresh eating apple. You may even notice a hint of pear.
profile: Tart, sweet flavorCrispy
best_uses: Fresh eatingExcellent for salads, pies, sauces and baking

name: Cortland
short_description: Picture a fresh fruit cup featuring beautiful, snow-white apples. It’s likely made with Cortland, New York’s very best salad apple. This great, all-purpose apple was developed at the New York State Agricultural Experiment Station in Geneva in 1898.
full_description: Picture a fresh fruit cup featuring beautiful, snow-white apples. It’s likely made with Cortland, New York’s very best salad apple. This great, all-purpose apple was developed at the New York State Agricultural Experiment Station in Geneva in 1898.
profile: Sweet, with a hint of tartnessJuicyTender, snow-white flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating, salads, sauces, pies and bakingGood for freezing
special_hint: Cortland apples are wonderful for kabobs, fruit plates and garnishes because they don’t turn brown quickly when cut.

name: Crispin
short_description: Bite into a Crispin for a great crunch and mouthful of sweet juice. The original name for this exceptional apple was Mutsu, reflecting its Japanese heritage. It was renamed Crispin in the late ‘60s and has been gaining fans ever since.
full_description: Bite into a Crispin for a great crunch and mouthful of sweet juice. The original name for this exceptional apple was Mutsu, reflecting its Japanese heritage. It was renamed Crispin in the late ‘60s and has been gaining fans ever since.
profile: Sweet, yet very refreshingVery juicyExtra crisp
best_uses: Excellent for eating, sauces, baking and freezingGood for salads and pies
special_hint: Try Crispins for roasting whole apples or thick slices. They’re a wonderful accompaniment for your favorite roast.

name: Empire
short_description: With the popular Red Delicious and McIntosh for parents, Empire was destined to be a hit when it was developed at Cornell University in the ‘40s. It's a sweet-tart combination that's very versatile.
full_description: With the popular Red Delicious and McIntosh for parents, Empire was destined to be a hit when it was developed at Cornell University in the ‘40s. It's a sweet-tart combination that's very versatile.
profile: Wonderful blend of sweet and tartJuicyVery crisp, creamy white flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating and saladsGood for sauces, baking, pies and freezing
special_hint: Small Empires are great for school lunches. Kids enjoy the sweet-tart taste and super crunchy texture.

name: Evercrisp®
short_description: Sweet, juicy and firm. This is a great apple for snacking and salads.
full_description: Sweet, juicy and firm. This is a great apple for snacking and salads.

name: Fortune
short_description: A spritely apple with a slightly spicy flavor. It’s a cross between a Red Spy and Empire apple, and was created at Cornell University.
full_description: A spritely apple with a slightly spicy flavor. It’s a cross between a Red Spy and Empire apple, and was created at Cornell University.
profile: Crisp, with a spicy flavor
best_uses: Excellent for pies and saucesGood for fresh eating
special_hint: Combine Fortune apples with a sweet apple, such as Golden Delicious, for tasty and well-balanced applesauce.

name: Fuji
short_description: Fuji apples have it all – they’re super sweet, wildly juicy, extremely crisp, and ideal for snacking. This Japanese apple has American parents, Red Delicious and Ralls Janet, an antique apple that goes back to the days of Thomas Jefferson and 1793.
full_description: Fuji apples have it all – they’re super sweet, wildly juicy, extremely crisp, and ideal for snacking. This Japanese apple has American parents, Red Delicious and Ralls Janet, an antique apple that goes back to the days of Thomas Jefferson and 1793.
profile: Very sweetExtremely juicyCrisp, cream colored flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating and saladsGood for sauces
special_hint: Fuji applesauce needs little or no sugar.

name: Gala
short_description: A great choice for snacking, Gala is a variety developed in New Zealand. It's got the mild flavor that "picky eaters" prefer, plus a striking bright yellow-red color that also makes it visually appealing.
full_description: A great choice for snacking, Gala is a variety developed in New Zealand. It's got the mild flavor that "picky eaters" prefer, plus a striking bright yellow-red color that also makes it visually appealing.
profile: Mild sweet flavorJuicyCrisp, creamy yellow flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating and salads
special_hint: Galas’ size, mellow flavor and thin skin make them a perfect choice for lunches and snacks for kids.

name: Ginger Gold
short_description: If you really want a fresh-picked apple in late summer, the early ripening Ginger Gold will satisfy your desire for a great snacking apple. Check them out early in the harvest season when this special new variety is readily available!
full_description: If you really want a fresh-picked apple in late summer, the early ripening Ginger Gold will satisfy your desire for a great snacking apple. Check them out early in the harvest season when this special new variety is readily available!
profile: Sweet with mildly tart overtonesFine textured, crisp cream-colored flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating and salads
special_hint: Ginger Gold is very slow to turn brown, so it’s an excellent choice for any fresh-cut apple use.

name: Golden Delicious
short_description: Ever hear that Golden Delicious is the yellow cousin of the popular Red Delicious apple? Actually, they are related in name only, but this honey sweet apple is a special treat all on its own.
full_description: Ever hear that Golden Delicious is the yellow cousin of the popular Red Delicious apple? Actually, they are related in name only, but this honey sweet apple is a special treat all on its own.
profile: Mild, sweet flavorJuicyCrisp, light yellow flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating, salads, and saucesGood for pies, baking, and freezing
special_hint: You can put less sugar in pies and sauces made from Golden Delicious apples, because of the natural sweetness these apples provide.

name: Granny Smith
short_description: Crisp and juicy. Good balance of tart and sweet. Perfect for baking, sautéing and snacking.
full_description: Crisp and juicy. Good balance of tart and sweet. Perfect for baking, sautéing and snacking.
profile: Uncompromising crispness with an enjoyable tart taste.
best_uses: Great for baking, sautéing, and salads.
special_hint: pair with a sweet, red apple like Gala for colorful, flavorful salads.

name: Honeycrisp
short_description: Sometimes the name of an apple says it all. Honeycrisp apples are honey sweet (with a touch of tart) and amazingly crisp. Kids love the taste, and it’s easy to see why this recent variety has continued to grow in popularity since its 1991 introduction in Minnesota. More Honeycrisp trees are being planted every year in New York to increase the annual harvest.
full_description: Sometimes the name of an apple says it all. Honeycrisp apples are honey sweet (with a touch of tart) and amazingly crisp. Kids love the taste, and it’s easy to see why this recent variety has continued to grow in popularity since its 1991 introduction in Minnesota. More Honeycrisp trees are being planted every year in New York to increase the annual harvest.
profile: Complex, sweet-tart flavorJuicySuper-crisp yellow flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating and saladsGood for sauces, baking, and pies
special_hint: These ultra-crisp apples appeal to children and teens. They’re a great way to encourage healthy snacking.

name: Idared
short_description: If you love the old-fashioned goodness of baked apples, Idareds are excellent, as they hold their shape perfectly and look beautiful on the table. Developed in Idaho, it’s a cross between two old-time New York apples, Jonathan and Wagener, that were first grown in Penn Yan in 1791.
full_description: If you love the old-fashioned goodness of baked apples, Idareds are excellent, as they hold their shape perfectly and look beautiful on the table. Developed in Idaho, it’s a cross between two old-time New York apples, Jonathan and Wagener, that were first grown in Penn Yan in 1791.
profile: Sweetly tartJuicyFirm, pale, yellow-green flesh, sometimes tinted rosy pink
best_uses: Excellent for sauces, cooking, baking and piesGood for eating, salads and freezing
special_hint: Idareds make a beautifully colored applesauce. Cook the apples with the skins on and strain the sauce to get the best pink color.

name: Jersey Mac
short_description: The Jersey Mac apple is crisp, juicy and sweet/tart. It is good for fresh eating, pies and applesauce.
full_description: The Jersey Mac apple is crisp, juicy and sweet/tart. It is good for fresh eating, pies and applesauce.
profile: SweetTartJuicy
best_uses: Good for fresh eatingGood for pies and applesauce
special_hint: Tender flesh cooks quickly, so add a thickener if making a pie.

name: Jonagold
short_description: Jonagold is another success story from the New York State Agricultural Experiment Station in Geneva. It's a cross between mellow Golden Delicious and tart Jonathan apples, and creates a great aroma when baked in apple pies.
full_description: Jonagold is another success story from the New York State Agricultural Experiment Station in Geneva. It's a cross between mellow Golden Delicious and tart Jonathan apples, and creates a great aroma when baked in apple pies.
profile: Honey sweet, with a hint of tartnessJuicyCrisp, creamy yellow flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating, salads, sauces, and bakingGood for pies and freezing
special_hint: Jonagolds also make great fried apples. Simply sauté in a little butter and add a touch of cinnamon. No sugar needed.

name: Jonamac
short_description: A cross between Jonathan and McIntosh apples, Jonamac is closer to a McIntosh in terms of flavor, just a bit sweeter. Many people love the touch-of-honey taste of a Jonamac, a great eating apple.
full_description: A cross between Jonathan and McIntosh apples, Jonamac is closer to a McIntosh in terms of flavor, just a bit sweeter. Many people love the touch-of-honey taste of a Jonamac, a great eating apple.
profile: Firm flesh, crispSweet/tart flavorCinnamon and nutmeg undertones
best_uses: Excellent for eating
special_hint: If you are a fan of Jonathan apples and want a softer, sweeter experience, try Jonamac.

name: Macoun
short_description: Looking for a perfect, no-fat dessert that will satisfy your sweet tooth? Macoun is the answer, but make sure you get yours at the right time, as these special apples are only available in the fall. Macoun was developed at the New York State Agricultural Experiment Station in Geneva in 1932, and is named for a famous Canadian fruit breeder.
full_description: Looking for a perfect, no-fat dessert that will satisfy your sweet tooth? Macoun is the answer, but make sure you get yours at the right time, as these special apples are only available in the fall. Macoun was developed at the New York State Agricultural Experiment Station in Geneva in 1932, and is named for a famous Canadian fruit breeder.
profile: Extra-sweet and aromaticVery juicyTender, snow-white flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eatingGood for sauces and salads
special_hint: Try serving Macoun slices with cheese for a sophisticated dessert in the autumn.

name: McIntosh
short_description: Juicy, tangy and aromatic. An all-time favorite for fresh eating and baking.
full_description: Juicy, tangy and aromatic. An all-time favorite for fresh eating and baking.
profile: Sweet, with a tart tangVery juicyTender, white flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating and saucesGood for salads and pies
special_hint: McIntosh’s tender flesh cooks down quickly. Add a thickener if making a pie.

name: Paula Red
short_description: If you like tart apples, take a healthy bite of a Paula Red. It's one of our earliest varieties to be harvested, and the first taste of fall for many apple lovers. Pick or shop early, because Paula Reds are only available from late August into October.
full_description: If you like tart apples, take a healthy bite of a Paula Red. It's one of our earliest varieties to be harvested, and the first taste of fall for many apple lovers. Pick or shop early, because Paula Reds are only available from late August into October.
profile: TartJuicyCrisp white flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eatingGood for applesauce
special_hint: Paula Red applesauce needs little or no sugar.

name: Red Delicious
short_description: These popular, mildly sweet apples are grown across the country, but only a New York Red Delicious has the slight tartness that gives this apple flavorful depth. If you haven’t tried a New York Red Delicious, you haven’t tried what we consider the best Delicious.
full_description: These popular, mildly sweet apples are grown across the country, but only a New York Red Delicious has the slight tartness that gives this apple flavorful depth. If you haven’t tried a New York Red Delicious, you haven’t tried what we consider the best Delicious.
profile: SweetJuicyCrisp, yellow flesh
best_uses: Excellent for eating and salads
special_hint: Red Delicious apples look great for a long time, so they are an ideal choice for holiday centerpieces and wreaths.

name: Rome
short_description: Great-looking fried apple slices, sitting next to a pork chop, are probably Romes. These superb apples retain their shape and tart flavor beautifully when cooked. This old-time variety originated in Ohio in 1816 but is widely grown in New York State.
full_description: Great-looking fried apple slices, sitting next to a pork chop, are probably Romes. These superb apples retain their shape and tart flavor beautifully when cooked. This old-time variety originated in Ohio in 1816 but is widely grown in New York State.
profile: Mildly tartFirm, greenish white flesh
best_uses: Excellent for sauces, baking and piesGood for salads and freezing
special_hint: Combine Romes with a sweet apple, such as Golden Delicious, for a nicely tart’n’ tasty blended applesauce.

name: RubyFrost®
short_description: 10 years in the making and developed by Cornell University’s apple breeding program, RubyFrost apples reach their peak flavor in the winter months. RubyFrost is an excellent choice for warm seasonal dishes, as well as an ideal baking apple thanks to its plump, luscious size. RubyFrost apples are the perfect balance of sweet and tart, deep and rich with a hearty crunch and ideal crisp texture. Be sure to try RubyFrost’s cousin apple, SnapDragon, which was also developed by Cornell University.
full_description: 10 years in the making and developed by Cornell University’s apple breeding program, RubyFrost apples reach their peak flavor in the winter months. RubyFrost is an excellent choice for warm seasonal dishes, as well as an ideal baking apple thanks to its plump, luscious size. RubyFrost apples are the perfect balance of sweet and tart, deep and rich with a hearty crunch and ideal crisp texture. Be sure to try RubyFrost’s cousin apple, SnapDragon, which was also developed by Cornell University.
profile: Perfect balance of sweet and tartDeep and rich with a hearty crunch and ideal crisp texture
best_uses: Excellent for eating, RubyFrost is the ultimate baking apple. Great for recipes both savory and sweet.
special_hint: RubyFrost is very high in Vitamin C and slow to brown, making it ideal for pies and tarts.

name: SnapDragon®
short_description: A new New York apple characterized by “monster crunch.” One of its parents is the Honeycrisp, and you’ll love the spicy/sweet flavor. Along with RubyFrost®, SnapDragon is one of two exciting new apples that were 10 years in the making and developed by Cornell University’s apple breeding program.
full_description: A new New York apple characterized by “monster crunch.” One of its parents is the Honeycrisp, and you’ll love the spicy/sweet flavor. Along with RubyFrost®, SnapDragon is one of two exciting new apples that were 10 years in the making and developed by Cornell University’s apple breeding program.
profile: Extra sweet, with hints of vanilla and spice.Two-napkin juicyCrispy texture
best_uses: Excellent for fresh eating, great for salads, and gourmet recipes. Pack a Snap for a sweet and healthy snack.
special_hint: If you like Honeycrisp, you’ll love SnapDragon. Annual high demand means the SnapDragon won’t be here long. Get yours before they’re all snapped up.

name: SweeTango®
short_description: Crunchy and sweet with a touch of citrus, honey and spice; an offspring of Honeycrisp and Zestar!
full_description: Crunchy and sweet with a touch of citrus, honey and spice; an offspring of Honeycrisp and Zestar!

name: WildTwist®
short_description: Two legendary apples have come together in a WildTwist®.
full_description: Two legendary apples have come together in a WildTwist®.

name: Zestar!®
short_description: An early season apple that’s juicy, with a light and crisp texture. Developed at the University of Minnesota, Zestar! trees are especially hardy and handle cold weather beautifully. Like the name says, there’s zesty flavor and crunch when you bite into one.
full_description: An early season apple that’s juicy, with a light and crisp texture. Developed at the University of Minnesota, Zestar! trees are especially hardy and handle cold weather beautifully. Like the name says, there’s zesty flavor and crunch when you bite into one.
profile: Crisp and juicySprightly, sweet/tart taste with a hint of brown sugar
best_uses: Excellent for eating
special_hint: Zestar! apples maintain their great taste and crunch for two months in refrigeration, so you can keep that zesty crunch after hours in a lunchbox, days in a fruit bowl, or even weeks in the refrigerator.
